turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Is there anything in these standards to assure that he knows something about the subject?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: Yes.

The Court requires that -- the Court says that maybe sufficient to appoint a guardian trained in the mental health field who would advocate the child's interest or alternatively have the power to obtain a lawyer to do so.
That way, you have the best of both worlds.
You have a lawyer available if it's necessary and you have a trained mental health advocate for the situations where you don't need to get lawyers involved.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Well, the advocate then is a different fellow from this trained mental health person?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: The advocate is the trained mental health person.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: You've lost me.
You've just been describing two people.
You said that a trained mental health person and the lawyer.

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: That's right.

The Court said that it may not always be necessary to appoint a lawyer then it might be sufficient if the state came up with a procedure to appoint a guardian, a person trained in the mental health field who could advocate for the child's rights or alternatively have the power to obtain a lawyer.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: The trained mental --

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: Would not make the decision on commitment.
That would be made by the --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Now, but the advocate would decide whether or not a lawyer --

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: Yes.
The lower court retreated from its earlier position that counsel was required in every case.
It is not correct that three examinations were made for each plaintiff --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: May I ask what folks in the mental health field are trained specially in advocacy?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: The federal law under the Developmental Disabilities Act requires every state to have protection and advocacy system for the retarded.
For the mentally ill, many states such as New Jersey which filed in amicus brief here.
New York has the mental health information service.
There are many legal and non-legal advocacy groups existing in the country, Mental Health Associations, National Association for Private Citizens.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Well, my question really was, how those in the mental health field get special training in advocacy?
Who gives them that?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: The -- I myself have participated on faculty at various continuing education kinds of proceedings to help teach people --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: I see.

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: -- how to be advocates in terms of the legal rights of patients.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: I see.
Is that widespread, that practice?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: In my view it is and I find myself spending in a lot of those --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: What was the basis for the congressional decision that requires states to have an advocacy system?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: The basis for that and I think there are findings prefatory to the statute.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Are those citations in your brief?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: No, no, they're not at all.
It's the Development Disabilities Act.

I can't remember the exact section which describes the need for people and institutions to receive proper treatment, the least restrictive treatment and protection of their rights and it was thought --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Are these just with respect to retarded children and who are the wards of the state?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: No.
Every retarded person whether institutionalized or not in the state, a condition of receiving any developmental disability funds and yearly all states do.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Are limited to retarded children?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: Limited to retarded and other developmentally disabled.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: (Inaudible)

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: Children and adults.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: This federal system wouldn't prevent Pennsylvania from implementing the system that's here under attack.

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: No, not at all but it would permit Pennsylvania to use the so-called PNA system Protection and Advocacy System to protect the rights of these children.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Is this person a sort of Ombudsman for the retarded?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: It requires as I understand it more individuals based advocacy.
It's not Ombudsman for the whole state one person.
There is a staff.
There is a system of using and training volunteers as well as professionals to provide independent legal advocacy.
The federal statute requires that the state mechanism have the means to institute legal actions as well as simply to be an Ombudsman.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Mr. Ferleger, before you sit down, just roughly how many of these applications of commitment are there in per year, something like that?
How big the problem, are we talking about administratively?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: The -- In Pennsylvania --

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Yes, in Pennsylvania.

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: Or in the country?

In Pennsylvania as I recall, the record below on the mentally ill when we had it from 0 to 18, there were during the year 300 or 400 commitments in the whole State of Pennsylvania of children from 0 to 18.
Nationally, 60% of commitments of children are children from 15 to 17 so we're probably talking about a rate of relatively few commitments.
For the retarded, many institutions in Pennsylvania no longer accept new commitments, institution where plaintiff George S. has not accepted any commitments since 1971 except under court order.
As Mr. Watkins indicated, states were treating more and more from the use of institutions.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: I'm trying to figure out how many people would be required to do the -- how many such people would as I assume that they probably develop a list but (Voice Overlap).

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: The local public defenders and legal services officers many of which have specialized mental health attorneys can easily do the job.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: What are the states doing with the mentally retarded?
What if Pennsylvania hasn't accepted this since 1971?

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: One institution, the Penhurst institution where plaintiff George S. is confined is a matter of their own policy has accepted no voluntary commitments since 1971.
Linda Glenn testified that in Massachusetts they have --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: What is Pennsylvania doing with them saying, “No, we will not accept them?”

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: See, the issue is what their needs are and Pennsylvania is attempting to provide non-institutional community services because the question is not simply, if you're mentally ill you're going to a hospital, if you're mentally retarded you do.
The question is what you need and is that an institution?

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: But the state is accepting them for treatment, it's just a question of where they do it.

turn.speaker: david_ferleger
turn.label: Mr. David Ferleger
turn.text: That's right.
I didn't make that clear enough.
Thank you.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Very well.
Mr. Watkins you have two minutes left.

turn.speaker: norman_j_watkins
turn.label: Mr. Norman J. Watkins
turn.text: Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.
I have but four points to make.
First, in response to two questions I believe delivered by Mr. Justice White, Flagg Brothers.
This Court's opinion in Flagg Brothers was decided on May 15th and the opinion of the lower court was rendered on May 25th so that --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Was that -- do you know where the Flagg Brothers was brought to their attention?

turn.speaker: norman_j_watkins
turn.label: Mr. Norman J. Watkins
turn.text: Unfortunately, my brief was filed well before this Court's decision in Flagg Brothers and I don't recall whether or not my opponent brought it to the Court's attention, I know --
